definition: to take unfair advantage of/to deceive/to cheat

sentences.english: He bullied people by flaunting his powerful connections.
The bullies range from schoolkids to corporate giants.
sentences.chinese: 欺侮来自从学生到大公司等各种人群。

sentences.english: It is wrong of you to bully the child.
How can you stomach their affronts?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么能够忍受他们的欺侮？

sentences.english: Then where did Judge Blount get the license to assault truth?
sentences.chinese: 那么布朗特法官又有什么特权欺侮真理呢？

sentences.english: Same-gender harassment defines the two most frequent categories of bullying.
sentences.chinese: 同性骚扰表现出两类最频繁发生的欺侮现象。

sentences.english: She quietly swallows the bully you brought to her.
sentences.chinese: 她默默地忍受着你对她的欺侮。

sentences.english: The reviewer's criticism was unnecessarily insulting.
sentences.chinese: 书评作者的批评没有必要这样欺侮人。

sentences.english: The British people were never colonised so they will not be bullied.
sentences.chinese: 英国人民从没有经历殖民统治，所以不甘遭人欺侮。

sentences.english: Were they pitiful maidens deflowered by fickle men?
sentences.chinese: 这是可怜的少女受了薄幸的男子欺侮？

definition: to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
see 恃強欺弱|恃强欺弱[shi4 qiang2 qi1 ruo4]
forced submission/to exploit advantage to force sb to do one's bidding
to use one's strength to bully the weak (idiom)
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
